text: I'm Eli Finkel I am a professor at
Northwestern University in the
psychology department and the Kellogg
School of Management and the name of my
new book is the all-or-nothing marriage
how the best marriages work what can we
do to make our marriage a bit stronger
well the the all-or-nothing marriage
perspective that I introduced in the
book suggests that we have three options
the first option is we can say I really
want this highly intensive sort of
marriage this extraordinary sort of
marriage that is available today and I'm
willing to work as much as it takes in
order to make the marriage as strong as
possible so that's extra time that's
extra attention to the relationship but
that's not the only option
right it may be that we have two young
kids at home or we're dealing with a
medical emergency or it's a slow-burning
crisis at work are there other things we
can do to strengthen the marriage and
the answer is yes and I talked about two
other options in the book the first of
which is think about our behavior our
partners behavior in a different sort of
way for example your partner does
something neglectful forgets your
birthday shows up late doesn't call when
he or she is supposed to call there are
various ways we can think about that
behavior one of which is my partner is a
jerk and it turns out research is clear
on this point that to the degree that
you tend to be somebody who makes that
sort of attribution or explanation for
your partner's behavior your marriage
will struggle instead you have options
to say well my partner probably had a
difficult day or it probably wasn't my
partner's fault at all there was
probably a traffic accident that led to
the traffic right and and these sorts of
explanations are much more benign and
much more relationship friendly there's
a third option that I wish people would
consider more seriously which is we can
ask less there's no rule that says you
absolutely have to ask the following
things of your marriage and so if you
find yourself chronically disappointed
in one element of your marriage or in a
subset of elements of your marriage one
of the really good ways of dealing with
that is to think about is it really
essential that I try to meet this need
in particular through the marriage there
may be some cases where you say yes
absolutely there's no way I would ever
want to meet this need through an
their person are on my own but there are
many things we look to our partner to
help us meet that we could just as
easily look somewhere else and one of
the best ways you can actually improve
the marriage is to find those places of
imbalance find the places where the
demands you're placing on the marriage
are clearly exceeding the amount that
the marriage can actually meet will just
take off some of the demands especially
in those cases
